captions.text: This weekend, Kevin and I have decided to take on the ultimate outdoor shower at the cottage
I'm Andrew. I'm Kevin.
Welcome to Brojects!
For the ultimate outdoor shower

we're gonna build up from adult swim
platform for upright post fit nicely
into deck blocks making a strong eight by eight structure
we use plywood to build half walls covered with cedar shingles inside and out
the upper half of the walls will be made of cored wood cut from various sizes to give it a great rustic look

we'll put in a simple front door for
privacy

and a custom sliding wall on the back
that opens to reveal a great view
of the lake while soaking in the tub
Since we're repurposing this thing we haven't...

it's not built really for what we need it
for so we have to play around with it a little bit here
and get it straightened out
The bathtub probably weighs three or four hundred pounds...when you fill it with water
its probably going to weigh five or six hundred
so we have to reinforce the underneath of this so it'll carry that load
We know we're under the gun for this one
so we're going to have to go really hard for the next couple of days
The Skyscraper!
We can make it a double decker shower?

We got a big day in front of us, we gotta
get the posts up, we gotta get the walls in
Next step put the top cross braces on
The sliding wall in front of the bathtub...in my opinion this is our feature item

and this is really gonna kinda bring it
up to the next level it's going to look

really nice when it's closed and then
when it moves
it's going to look really cool because you're going to see the lake in the background, it's going to be a nice vista

I think the art piece is probably gonna be
good it's gonna be a nice feature
but I've basically been doing this solo

Andrews not behind this part of the
project at all...I don't understand why
he just doesn't get it, I don't understand... usually this is his type of thing

this stuff is hard to do by yourself
trying to hold and cut at the same time
ends up you know...you inevitably hurt yourself
Next up is the plumbing!
the pump, the plumbing, the heating
I don't know, we don't even know what we're doing with that yet
I think we need to talk to Walker for that stuff
Yea

So what we have here is a two-stage pumping system we're
going to use to power the shower

and essentially what we're going to do is
just run a garden hose from the lake and

we're gonna use in line utility pump
it's gonna fill our rain barrel
and from the barrel

all we need to do is get pressure to are
propane fired heater

It's coming out fast that's actually
pretty decent flow
that's going to be our shower pressure
The rain is unfortunate and a grey day its a
just kind of unfortunate the way it came in at the last minute
Lets stop admiring and go get in it
How is it?
Awesome!
Yea?
This is amazing man!
Really?
Absolutely...Its amazing
No cleaner shower curtain than here
That's right!
And the flows totally fine
These tubs are so comfortable!
They are they made them right
Why did they stop building these things?
Because they are about eight hundred pounds
We've got the four chairs...basically everything you need for a fire
The chop chair is a place to chop your firewood but it also contains a fire starting kit
and a built-in bellows to really get the fire going
to get this party going the music chair has a built-in kick drum
a guitar amp and a few instruments to be passed around

title: How to make an Outdoor Shower
